intro: Hieracium liptoviense, commonly known as the Liptovský Hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the Liptov region of Slovakia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates with well-drained soil. It features a basal rosette of leaves and can reach a height of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
